data.text: A covering for the head, especially one with a shaped crown and brim.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A head covering of distinctive color and shape worn as a symbol of office.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The office symbolized by the wearing of such a head covering.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A role or office symbolized by or as if by the wearing of different hats.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: wears two hats—one as parent and one as corporate executive.

data.text: To supply or cover with a hat.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: (at the drop of a hat) At the slightest pretext or provocation.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: (hat in hand) In a humble manner; humbly.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: (take (one's) hat off to) To respect, admire, or congratulate.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
